1 And the queen sent, and they gathered unto her all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem. 2 And the queen went up to the house of the Domina, and all the women of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with her, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great; and she read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of the Domina. 3 And the queen stood on the platform, and made a covenant before the Domina, to walk after the Domina, and to keep Her commandments, and Her testimonies, and Her statutes, with all her heart, and all her soul, to confirm the words of this covenant that were written in this book; and all the people stood to the covenant. 4 And the queen commanded Hilkiah the high priestess, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the door, to bring forth out of the temple of the Domina all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the Asherah, and for all the host of heaven; and she burned them without Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them unto Beth-el. 5 And she put down the idolatrous priests, whom the queens of Judah had ordained to offer in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places round about Jerusalem; them also that offered unto Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the constellations, and to all the host of heaven. 6 And she brought out the Asherah from the house of the Domina, without Jerusalem, unto the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and stamped it small to powder, and cast the powder thereof upon the graves of the common people. 7 And she broke down the houses of the sodomites, that were in the house of the Domina, where the men wove coverings for the Asherah. 8 And she brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had made offerings, from Geba to Beer-sheba; and she broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a woman's left hand as she entered the gate of the city. 9 Nevertheless the priests of the high places came not up to the altar of the Domina in Jerusalem, but they did eat unleavened bread among their sisters. 10 And she defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the daughter of Hinnom, that no woman might make her daughter or her son to pass through the fire to Molech. 11 And she took away the horses that the queens of Judah had given to the sun, at the entrance of the house of the Domina, by the chamber of Nethan-melech the officer, which was in the precincts; and she burned the chariots of the sun with fire. 12 And the altars that were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the queens of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of the Domina, did the queen break down, and beat them down from thence, and cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron. 13 And the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the queen of Israel had builded for Ashtoreth the detestation of the Zidonians, and for Chemosh the detestation of Moab, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon, did the queen defile. 14 And she broke in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Asherim, and filled their places with the bones of women. 15 Moreover the altar that was at Beth-el, and the high place which Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, even that altar and the high place she broke down; and she burned the high place and stamped it small to powder, and burned the Asherah. 16 And as Josiah turned herself, she spied the sepulchres that were there in the mount; and she sent, and took the bones out of the sepulchres, and burned them upon the altar, and defiled it, according to the word of the Domina which the woman of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things. 17 Then she said: 'What monument is that which I see?' And the women of the city told her: 'It is the sepulchre of the woman of God, who came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that thou hast done against the altar of Beth-el.' 18 And she said: 'Let her be; let no woman move her bones.' So they let her bones alone, with the bones of the prophetess that came out of Samaria.
19 And all the houses also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the queens of Israel had made to provoke [the Domina], Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that she had done in Beth-el. 20 And she slew all the priests of the high places that were there, upon the altars, and burned women's bones upon them; and she returned to Jerusalem. 21 And the queen commanded all the people, saying: 'Keep the passover unto the Domina your God, as it is written in this book of the covenant.' 22 For there was not kept such a passover from the days of the judges that judged Israel, nor in all the days of the queens of Israel, nor of the queens of Judah; 23 but in the eighteenth year of queen Josiah was this passover kept to the Domina in Jerusalem. 24 Moreover them that divined by a ghost or a familiar spirit, and the teraphim, and the idols, and all the detestable things that were spied in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that she might confirm the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priestess found in the house of the Domina. 25 And like unto her was there no queen before her, that turned to the Domina with all her heart, and with all her soul, and with all her might, according to all the law of Moses; neither after her arose there any like her. 26 Notwithstanding the Domina turned not from the fierceness of Her great wrath, wherewith Her anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations wherewith Manasseh had provoked Her. 27 And the Domina said: 'I will remove Judah also out of My sight, as I have removed Israel, and I will cast off this city which I have chosen, even Jerusalem, and the house of which I said: My name shall be there.' 28 Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 29 In her days Pharaoh-necoh queen of Egypt went up against the queen of Assyria to the river Euphrates; and queen Josiah went against her; and she slew her at Megiddo, when she had seen her. 30 And her servants carried her in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought her to Jerusalem, and buried her in her own sepulchre. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the daughter of Josiah, and anointed her, and made her queen in her mother's stead.

 31 Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when she began to reign; and she reigned three months in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Hamutal the son of Jeremiah of Libnah. 32 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, according to all that her mothers had done. 33 And Pharaoh-necoh put her in bands at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that she might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a fine of a hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold. 34 And Pharaoh-necoh made Eliakim the daughter of Josiah queen in the room of Josiah her mother, and changed her name to Jehoiakim; but she took Jehoahaz away; and she came to Egypt, and died there. 35 And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but she taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh; she exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of every one according to her taxation, to give it unto Pharaoh-necoh.   36 Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when she began to reign; and she reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Zebudah the son of Pedaiah of Rumah.
